apparatuswrap.TR:
Having bowed to [Him] who has no beginning, middle part and end,
whose boundaries are limitless, who is very subtle and who
is the unmanifest and fine essence of the world,
who is ... [to be worshipped?] by Hari, Indra, Brahmā and the other [gods],
I shall teach the Compendium on the Essence of the Bull.
apparatuswrap.NOTE: Pāda a: dvandva? (Flo) Parallels for anādimadhyānta. pāragaṃ in K82K10: the same extra syllable as in pāda d. Pāda b: probably not jagatsu sāraṃ. Pāda c is unmetrical, or rather, licence with br. samagra might work Flo. What is āsamagram in pāda c? āsam agram? arcyam, arhyam, īḍyam? Is pāda d hypermetrical? It is actually a vaṃśastha (triṣṭubh - jagatī change). Note the repetition of sāra in this verse. Rhymes?

apparatuswrap.TR:

to test him he humbly asked the one who performed immaterial sacrifices
[i.e. Anarthayajña] a question, [Anarthayajña,] the one who was focused
in his austerities and observances,

and whose conduct was virtuous and pure, and who was intent on
compassion towards all living beings.

No universal floods come, and there are no days and nights of Brahmā.
There is no birth and death there and one never encounters catastrophes.

apparatuswrap.TR:
Nobody is tied to noose of hope and there is no passion or delusion.
There are no gods and demons there and no Yakṣas, Serpents and Rākṣasas.

mainwrap.TEXT: na bhūtā na piśācāś ca gandharvā ṛṣayas tathā |

apparatuswrap.TR:
There are no Ghosts and Piśācas, no Gandharvas and Ṛṣis.
There are no asterisms and planets there, no Nāgas, Kiṃnaras or Garuḍa-like creatures.

There are no religious observances and no austerities and no 'animal hell'.

All of them can change their shapes on their own accord [just bending etc.?] and

[any language? maybe not].

apparatuswrap.TR:
There [in the Śivāṇḍa], O Brahmin, all the subjects are the oceans of endless virtues.
They are all equally beautiful and strong, and they shine like millions of suns.

to those who are in need of it,
or gives his wife, his son and his possessions or his own head to those in need,
or by [performing] other difficult deeds, will not be able to go there.

the austerities, the donations, the study of the Vedas,
will experience those enjoyments that the Brahmāṇḍa offers, still being
subject to time and death.

Dharma decays with time that is sent by...
Like a circle of burning coal, time goes round and round.
Time is called 'kāla' because of the waves (kalana)
of the three divisions of time [past, present, future].

apparatuswrap.TR: Just command me quickly, O Brahmin. What is your desire?
There is nothing that should not be donated to a Brahmin, beginning with one's own head, O Brahmin.''

mainwrap.TEXT: yady evaṃ vadase bhadra bhāryāṃ me dehi rūpiṇīm |

apparatuswrap.TR: ``If you talk like this, my dear, give me your beautiful wife.

apparatuswrap.TR: Be happy, may you be fortunate, and may you prosper eternally!''
Vipula spoke:
``Accept my wife who has nice buttocks, and is young and beautiful,
unreproached, large-eyed and whose face resembles the full-moon.''

body.TR: The exposition of the essence of yoga

apparatuswrap.TR: Devī spoke:
Now I would like to hear the exposition of the essence of yoga.
Furthermore teach me about the Karaṇa [exercises?], according to the rules, O Sureśvara.
Īśvara spoke:
apparatuswrap.APP: 2 īśvara C94C45; sureśa K82, bhagavān E

apparatuswrap.TR: Listen, o Devī, I shall teach you the supreme essence of yoga,

mainwrap.TEXT: yaṃ viditvā na paśyanti janāḥ saṃsārabandhanam ||16.2||

apparatuswrap.TR: by knowing which people will cease to experience the fetter of mundane existence.

mainwrap.TEXT: brahmahā gurutalpī vā surāpasteya eva vā |

apparatuswrap.TR: [One can be] a Brahmin-slayer, a violator of his teacher's bed, a drunkard, a thief

mainwrap.TEXT: athavā saṃkare jātas tat sarvam apanodati ||16.3||

apparatuswrap.TR: or can be born into a mixed caste: it [i.e. yoga] will eliminate all [of his sins].
apparatuswrap.APP: 3c saṃkare K82; śṛṅkare C94, śaṅkare C45E

apparatuswrap.TR: If the knower of yoga practises yoga for half a moment or for a moment,

mainwrap.TEXT: brahmaloke dhruvaṃ vāso viṣṇuloke ca sundari ||16.11||

apparatuswrap.TR: he will surely abide in Brahmā's and Viṣṇu's homes, O Sundarī.
He will experience thousands of karmas, while he has all possible desires.

mainwrap.TEXT: kṣīṇapuṇye tato martye jāyate vipule kule ||16.12||

apparatuswrap.TR: Then when his merits are exhausted, he will be born in the world of mortals, in a noble family.

apparatuswrap.TR: He should practise only yoga, and he will be a man who remembers his own previous births.
Crossing the ocean of mundane existence, he will obtain Śivaness.
The technique of yoga

[With his body] purified and his mind concentrated, the yogin should sit down assuming a sitting posture (āsana) in a place which is devoid of humans and noise,

mainwrap.TEXT: lakṣaṇaṃ tasya rājendra śṛṇu vakṣyāmi sāmpratam |

tena sarvamakhairiṣṭaṃ tena taptaṃ taptaṃ tathā |

yādṛśaṃ pañcamaḥ proktaṃ saptame ca prayojayet |

ācārāl labhatīha āyur atulam aiśvaryavittaṃ tathā
ācārāt sutam īpsitaṃ ca labhate śrīkīrtiprajñāyaśaḥ |
ācārāl labhate ca lakṣmim atulaṃ khyātiṃ tathaivottamam
ācārāt katidhāṅga kīrtaya punas tṛptir na me jāyate |
sarvajñaḥ tvam ahaṃ śṛṇomi varadaṃ kiñcin na me śāśvaram
śasye bhasmani govrajedvijajalaṃ kuryān na cārkaṃ naraḥ ||22.54||
pādenāgnijalaṃ spṛśen na ca guruṃ pādena pādaṃ tathā
śaucaṃ kārya jalādinā ca niyataṃ nādho jalaṃ kārayet |
strīṇāṃ kiṃ priyam asti tad vada vibho saṃsārasārastriyām
kiṃ sadbhāva na vedmi tasya viṣaye kiṃ dveṣya kiṃ tātpriyam |
paśyāmi na ca tasya garbhakalayā prāpnoti niḥsaṃśayam
rājan kiṃ priyam asti arthaparataḥ paśyāmi nānyan nṛpe
māyā vāpi karoti sadya manujātyaktānya vā sevate ||22.57||
strīhetor api candramāstribhuvane dhiktāṃ gataś cāmaro |
daṇḍakṣo hatarāṣṭrapaurasahitaḥ kiṃ bhūya vakṣyāmy aham ||22.58||
vipre kīdṛśalakṣaṇaṃ bhavati bho kīdṛg muniś cocyate
tenārthena bhaveta bhikṣu bhagavan nigranthi ko vā dvija |
kenārthena bhaved dvijendra bhagavan jñeyaḥ parivrājakaḥ
! jñeyāḥ kim ṛṣayaś ca lakṣaṇa muner icchāmi jñātuṃ punaḥ ||22.59||
satyaṃ śaucam ahiṃsatā damaśamau bhūtānukampī sadā
evaṃ yaḥ kurute dvijātisuvaraḥ śūdro 'pi yaḥ saṃyamī ||22.60||
yat tat sthānaparaṃ vrajanti puruṣāḥ tasmāt parivrājakaḥ |
granthidārasutaṃ dhanaṃś ca virati nirgranthika socyate
ramyante ṛṣir āśrame dhṛtimanas tasmād ṛṣiḥ socyate ||22.61||
sarvaṃ tat kathito 'si lakṣaṇa mayā sandhiśvanirnāśanam
etaj jñānaparaṃ prabodham atulaṃ nityaṃ śivaṃ dhāryate ||22.63||

mainwrap.TEXT: muniś ca dundubhiś caiva sutādyutimatas tu vai |

lāṅgalo vṛṣadvīpaś ca dvīpo bhadrākaras tathā ||24.29||
candradvīpaś ca sindhuś ca nandanadvīpa eva ca |
nāgadvīpas tathā saumyo gandharvaś cātha vāruṇaḥ |
merumūle tu rājendra jñeyo varṣa ilāvṛtaḥ |
uttaraṇeṇa (uttareṇa?) tu nīlasya varṣa ramyaka ucyate ||24.35||
tasya cottarapārśve tu varṣaḥ kuruvale smṛtaḥ |
pūrvaṃ bhadrāśvato jñeyaḥ ketumālas tu paścime ||24.37||
himaṃvān hemakūṭaś ca niṣadho nīla eva ca |
śvetaś ca śṛṅgavantaś ca ṣaḍ ete varṣaparvatāḥ ||24.38||
himavān hemakūṭaś ca niṣadhaś ceti dakṣiṇa ||24.39||
śvetaś caivatriśṛṅgaś ca nīlaś caiva tathottare |
yamaḥ saṃyamanī nāma nityaṃ vasati bhūpate |
naiṛtir vasati nityaṃ ramye śuddhavatī pure ||24.43||
varuṇo bhogavatyāṃ tu vāyor gandhavatī purī |
bhadrāśvaṃ plāvayitvā tu vanāny upavanāni ca |
mero vai dakṣiṇe pārśve jambūvṛkṣaḥ sanātanaḥ |
tena nāmāṅkito rājan jambūdvīpa iti śrutam ||24.53||
tasmād bāhyaḥ samudro bhūd garbhādeti samudrarāṭ |
etad bhūrlokavistāro hy ata ūrdhvabhuvaḥ smṛtaḥ |
brahmalokaḥ smṛtaḥ satyaṃ viṣṇulokam ataḥ param ||24.59||
devyā saha mahābhāgo gaṇaiś ca parivāritaḥ ||24.63||
pāvanī ca vareṇyā ca varārhāvaradā varā |
golokaḥ śivalokaś ca eka eva vidhīyate ||24.69||
tasmād ūrdhaṃ paraṃ jñeyaṃ sthānatrayam anuttamam |
